subject: LCW Training Opportunity
body:
Hi, Bastian – 
 
We have a prospect in Germany that is considering purchasing a session or two of ‘Working with India” for their German staff. They are moving some operations to India and have been experiencing a number of intercultural challenges. We are pricing translating the deck into German for them and providing in-person and virtual options. I think their preference is in-person in Germany but they may go with the less expensive option.
 
We don’t yet have a specific date but they would like it as soon as possible. However, it will take 3-4 weeks to complete the translation of the deck. So we are looking at possibly end of July to early August.
 
Do you have any interest or bandwidth?
 
I look forward to hearing from you.
 
Chuck
 
Chuck Adams

subject: Ubisoft - Leaders Cohort 8 // Facilitators
body:
Hey Bastian – hope you are well and that you had time to rest over the weekend.
 
As per our discussion last week, I wanted to pick up the thread on planning for Ubisoft Leaders Cohort 8 
We have 16 participants, either based in Europe/Canada/US & LATAM – so no need for various groups/timezones. 
As a reminder, Theoria won’t be your partner on this iteration : I will 
😊
 
 
Part 1 // October 30
th
 – 5 to 7PM // I believe you mentioned it was ok for you Bastian? 
Would you mind creating the teams link
 ? & let me know if you’d like for us to have a catch up before that
 
Part 2 // November 9
th
 – morning in Paris. You mentioned Bastian that you had a training in Milan on November 8, ending at 7PM. 
I had identified a plane leaving Milan at 8:50PM still ok for you?
 You also told me you had another training on November 9 afternoon? 
What is the timing so that I can book you a room?
 I remembered it being in the afternoon, otherwise I would have asked Caroline to switch our sessions so that we would intervene in the afternoon of Nov 9 instead of the morning. 
 
Part 3// November 20
th
, 4 to 6PM Paris time // 
I believe you mentioned it was ok for you Bastian
? 
 
Best & take care,  
Raphaëlle

subject: RE: Advancing Inclusion for Leaders FACILITATORS
body:
Hey Bastian & Theoria – do you want us to 
sync ahead of Nov 2 session
 – even asynchronously ? As a reminder, it’s been divided in 
2 groups/2 timezones
. 
 
Could you also send me the 
final version of the deck you have worked on
 ? including the changes that were presented on October 19? Thanks 
 
Nov2 will be dedicated to action planning & will be the last session for cohort 7. 
 
As a reminder, here is the list of challenges discussed during the codev session on October 19: 
 
CHALLENGES in the ROOM: 
Table 1: how can I accelerate the process of inclusivity in my large team 
Connect with experts for the assessment - doing the investigation 
Table 2: as a Leader I have a challenge with gender diversity in IT 
Be more active & headhunt + for senior positions instead of just waiting for the pipeline to produce
Table 3: I want to create a diverse team. How do I address language & cultural barriers 
Be more formal into communicating to your team that there is a person in the team who can help with language barriers & facilitation 
Table 4: Self awareness. How can I improve myself and be aware of my hidden bias.  
Talk to diverse people in the team or connect with RH to know how they are feeling in the team 
 
What did you learn today that you are willing to build going forward: 
Diversity has a cost but it's a cost we should be willing to go forward
Use resources available (Alexandre from NEO) and ask help to your peers 
Make it know to my team that this is a topic that team members can come to me to share 
As a leader, we are not perfect // we feel the pressure of needing to be perfect, especially from our team members. And we need our team members to see our vulnerability and to understand we would make mistakes
Denis spoke about Self ID and we need to promote it 
  
Raashi’s parting words : 
Share with your teams about this week & share your D&I commitment from today 
You have a team that you can reach out (D&I + HR + ERGs) + your peers 
We need your leadership, your accountability & vulnerability 
 
All the best & Bastian, will write to you separately for Cohort 8 – notably regarding travel 
 
Raphaëlle

 Bastian Küntzel <bastian@incontro-training.org>

2 important news for you to have in mind w/a view to tomorrow’s session:

 .
October 5 = release of the latest game in our Assasssin’s creed franchise: Mirage, set in 9
th
 century Bagdad. Reviews just  started coming out, praising the authentic feel of the city + Arabic dubbing in the game
So the folks tomorrow may be experiencing a range of emotions, connected to both events. 2 participants are connected to the Assassin’s creed brand- while not working in the Studio that developed the game (Bordeaux, France)
 
At your disposal for more info
Best
Raphaëlle

subject: Hello/Recommendation for facilitators
body:
Hi Bastian,
 
I hope this message finds you well. I believe we may have corresponded before, but I do not believe we have had the opportunity to meet. 
 
Tamara mentioned that you might be a good place to start for recommendations on European interculturalists who could contribute to some regionalization and delivery of content on the Cultural Context of People with Disabilities, visible and invisible. I am working with (2) organizations that would like to have this content delivered in Europe in a regionally relevant way. Based on your knowledge of LCW’s content, do you have any recommendations for someone who may be a good partner for us in this space Please let me know if I can clarify this in any way.
 
Thank you for your help, and I hope that we meet virtually or otherwise sometime soon!
 
Thanks,
Dan
 
 
 
Daniel Gough, PhD
(he/him)

On 31 May 2023 at 17:06 +0200, Tamara Thorpe <
t.thorpe@lcwmail.com
>, wrote:
Hello Bastian,
 
I’m reaching out to you to follow up on a new SOW I mentioned to you via WhatsApp. We have been working with Richemont Americas for the past two years, and our starting a new relationship with their Global Headquarters based in Geneva. 
Richemont
 is a luxury brand company with numerous fashion houses (maisons) including Cartier, Mont Blanc, Van Cleef and Arpels and more.
 
We are partnering with Dough Melville, the first American to ever work in their Geneva office, and their very first Global Head of DEI. As a first step we are going to work with their Human Resource Directors (HRDs) to provide IDI’s then deliver a 2-hour in-person session in Geneva at their annual conference September 26-28. The expectation is that we will be there one day in advance and for the day of training. Doug would like us there for 2 days and 2 nights.
 
Can you please confirm your interest and availability? And once confirmed, Nassise will send you over a new PA for you.
 
Let me know if you have any questions.
 
All the best,
Tamara
 
 
 
-
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tamara Thorpe (she/her)

subject: RE: Advancing Inclusion PREWORK
body:
Hi Tamara, thank you very much! 
Looking forward to reading you on the CCMP. 
@Bastian Kuntzel
& 
@Annelie Wambeek
: Céline Parsoud on my team will be here for you on March 9! She's D&I manager in France. Raashi should be here - barring any strikes! If she is here, she'll be the one doing the intro. Should there be any problem, Céline will introduce you& the session 
I will connect you & all the best 
Raphaëlle 
De :
 Tamara Thorpe <t.thorpe@lcwmail.com>
Envoyé :
 vendredi 3 mars 2023 00:24
À :
 Raphaëlle Lalo <raphaelle.lalo@ubisoft.com>
Cc :
 Conner Williams <c.williams@lcwmail.com>; Annelie Wambeek <A.wambeek@lcwmail.com>; Bastian Kuntzel <B.Kuntzel@lcwmail.com>
Objet :
 Advancing Inclusion PREWORK
 
 
Hello Raphaelle,
 
As discussed, the prework for Cohort 6 Advancing Inclusion will be the Culture and Identity e-Learning. Here is the link to share with participants: 
https://app.cloud.scorm.com/sc/InvitationConfirmEmail?publicInvitationId=5284ce74-0f63-4901-a889-5aef15483aba
 
It is live and will be until March 31
st
. I will get a completion report on March 7
th
 in advance of the March 9
th
 onsite.
 
I’ve also made the final adjustments to the deck; I’ve attached a PDF for Raashi to have.
 
Let us know if there is anything else needed in advance of the March 9
th
 session. I’ll have more insights for you on the CCMP Lesson 5 updates early next week.
 
All the best,
Tamara
